Here's the exact sequence of commands to commit your latest code (with language support) and push it to GitHub.
Make sure you run these inside your project folder and the virtual-env is optional (not required for Git operations).

bash © Copy

git add excuse_api.py README.md
git commit -m "feat: add multi-language support (language field) and keep apology mode"

git push

After the push finishes, refresh

https: //github.com/Bhuvan—Arora-1313/excuse-generator
and you'll see the new commit listed.

That's it—your latest working version is now on GitHub.
